Context: Adult male wild-type C57BL-6 mice were fed a standard diet or HFD, supplemented with either placebo or the bifidobacterial strain for 13 weeks.
Animals, Diets, and Experimental Design Adult (age 6–8 weeks) male wild-type C57BL-6 mice were purchased from Charles River Laboratories (L’Arbresle Cedex, France).
Stetz J, Hunt K, Kendall KC, Wasser SK (2013) Effects of exposure, diet, and thermoregulation on fecal glucocorticoid measures in wild bears.
During the adaptation period (7 days), each animal was housed in a stainless-steel cage in a temperaturecontrolled (23 °C) room with a 12-h light/dark cycle and 40– 50% relative humidity.

To induce obesity in two of the experimental groups, mice were switched from the SD (CA.170481— AIN-76A Purified Diet-Rats/Mice, Harlan Laboratories, Madison, WI 53744-4220), administered during the adaptation period, to a HFD (TD.06414—Adjusted Calories Diet— 60/Fat, Harlan Laboratories, Madison, WI 53744-4220) for 14 weeks.
Sharma S, Fulton S (2013) Diet-induced obesity promotes depressive-like behaviour that is associated with neural adaptations in brain reward circuitry.
De Kloet ER, Joels M, Holsboer F (2005) Stress and the brain: from adaptation to disease.
